sections.title: Description
sections.raw_content: The hasch procedure is used to determine if there is a character that has been typed but not yet been read.
sections.text_content: The hasch procedure is used to determine if there is a character that has been typed but not yet been read.
sections.mdown_content: The **hasch** procedure is used to determine if there is a character that has been typed but not yet been read.

sections.title: Example
code:
procedure flush
            var ch : string ( 1 )
            loop
                exit when not hasch
                getch ( ch )    % Discard this character
            end loop
        end flush
sections.raw_content: The flush procedure gets rid of any characters that have been typed but not yet read.
sections.text_content: The flush procedure gets rid of any characters that have been typed but not yet read.
sections.mdown_content: The _flush_ procedure gets rid of any characters that have been typed but not yet read.

sections.title: Details
sections.raw_content: The screen should be in a "screen" or "graphics" mode. See the View.Set procedure for details. If the screen is not in one of these modes, it will automatically be set to "screen" mode.
sections.text_content: The screen should be in a "screen" or "graphics" mode. See the View.Set procedure for details. If the screen is not in one of these modes, it will automatically be set to "screen" mode.
sections.mdown_content: The screen should be in a "_screen_" or "_graphics_" mode. See the **View.Set** procedure for details. If the screen is not in one of these modes, it will automatically be set to "_screen_" mode.
